publicationstmt.publisher: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-03 13:21:47 -0400.

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: Contains primarily Shill's extensive college notes which represent early twentieth century curriculum in History, Chemistry, Physics, Biology and Mathematics as well as teaching methods of the day. This academic material also includes a collection of Textbooks (1910-1932). In addition to her own papers, the collection also includes academic materials belonging to Gertrude's uncle, George Shill, including instruction pages, question pages and completed assignments from the International Correspondence School in Scranton, PA (1898-1900).
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Gertrude Shill was a college student in the early twentieth century who studied History, Chemistry, Physics, Biology and Mathematics.Gertrude's uncle, George Shill, worked at the International Correspondence School in Scranton, PA (1898-1900).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This cocllection primarily contains Shill's extensive college notes which represent early twentieth century curriculum in History, Chemistry, Physics, Biology and Mathematics as well as teaching methods of the day. This academic material also includes a collection of Textbooks (1910-1932). In addition to her own papers, the collection also includes academic materials belonging to Gertrude's uncle, George Shill, including instruction pages, question pages and completed assignments from the International Correspondence School in Scranton, PA (1898-1900).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. Please contact an archivist for more information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites. Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder. The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks. The University Archives are eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Gertrude Shill Papers, 1888-1934. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Shill Papers).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives, yet little acquisition documentation exists. The undated original accession record for the collection was last updated on January 23rd, 2015.
